bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 28, 1915

div1.p: Blue orders Carter to delay his investigation until the waters recede.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 28, 1915
div1.opener:
J.R.S.
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 28, 1915.
Senior Surgeon H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Md.
Sir:-
div1.p:
In view of your statement over the phone that the stage
of water is too high to begin the investigations of the im-
pounding reservoir in South Carolina, you are instructed to
defer carrying out the orders of January 26th relating thereto.

When information shall have been received by you to the
effect that conditions are favorable to beginning these in-
vestigations, you are requested to inform the Bureau in
order that the study may be undertaken by February 15th or
shortly thereafter. Sanitary Engineer Le Prince will be
instructed to defer his departure pending the receipt of
telegraphic instructions which will be sent on receiving in-
formation from you regarding a suitable date to begin the
work.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon-General. J
AnS
